header_summary:
Ava Chow announced the release of Bitcoin Core version 28.1, highlighting its new features, bug fixes, and compatibility with multiple operating systems. This version introduces changes to peer-to-peer configurations and updates addressing various technical aspects, including improvements in handling secret data and build system adjustments. Users are encouraged to download the update from [Bitcoin Core's official website](https://bitcoincore.org/bin/bitcoin-core-28.1) and participate in the project through reporting issues or joining the announcement list.

Antoine Riard is pursuing legal action against Matthew Corallo concerning governance and respect issues within open-source software projects, stemming from their work on the rust-lightning project. Riard's move illustrates a significant disagreement over leadership styles and project contributions, emphasizing the need for a civilized resolution process that may influence the broader interpretation of "decentralization" in open-source development. More details can be found in the ongoing discussion at [this link](https://delvingbitcoin.org/t/code-of-conduct-violation-banning-antoine-riard-for-3-months/1254/3).

Discussions on Braidpool's operation and transaction fee optimization offer insights into the technical and strategic challenges in decentralized networks. mcelrath explores decision-making complexities in Braidpool, including the potential for hard forks and policy updates, whereas lorbax delves into optimizing transaction fees through a mathematical proof, highlighting the importance of transaction selection based on fee rates and structural constraints. These discussions reflect ongoing efforts to enhance operational efficiency and flexibility in transaction handling within blockchain frameworks, with further information available at [Braidpool's exploration](https://delvingbitcoin.org/t/deterministic-tx-selection-for-censorship-resistance/842/12) and [transaction fee optimization](https://delvingbitcoin.org/t/how-to-linearize-your-cluster/303/8).

recent_posts.title: Bitcoin Core 28.1 Released
recent_posts.summary:
- Bitcoin Core version 28.1 is released, offering new features, bug fixes, and improvements.
- Users upgrading from older versions should completely shut down before installing 28.1.
- The update includes P2P configuration changes and is compatible with newer operating systems.

recent_posts.title: Code of Conduct Violation: Banning Antoine Riard for 3 months
recent_posts.summary:
- Antoine Riard intends to sue Matthew Corallo, indicating potential litigation in North Carolina.
- Their legal dispute stems from disagreements over governance and respect in open-source projects.
- Riard seeks legal resolution to legitimate principles, potentially escalating to the Supreme Court if needed.

recent_posts.title: Deterministic tx selection for censorship resistance
recent_posts.summary:
- Braidpool, akin to Bitcoin, has complex decision-making for transactions.
- Upgrading nodes and hard forks highlight management challenges in Braidpool.
- A proposal exists to include non-committed transactions for balance in efficiency and flexibility.

recent_posts.title: How to linearize your cluster
recent_posts.summary:
- The argument focuses on optimizing transaction fees by selecting a high-fee subset, $pot$.
- $pot$ is unique in containing the highest fee transactions, as per a specific inclusion and exclusion.
- The proposition proves maximizing fee rates involves including subsets $C$ in a larger set $B$.

active_posts.title: Summary: Covenants Support - Bitcoin Wiki
active_posts.summary:
- In November 2024, significant updates were made to the Bitcoin covenants support wiki.
- Feedback from Murch and Gloria on Bitcoin optech podcast led to the development of a dedicated page.
- A call to action emphasized the need for technical consensus and collaborative effort in covenant refinement.

active_posts.title: Mandatory Inclusion of Old Transactions in Blocks
active_posts.summary:
- The proposal mandates Bitcoin miners to include 0.1% oldest transactions in each block.
- It aims to combat mining centralization and transaction censorship, enhancing democratic processing.
- Expected benefits include enhanced censorship resistance, inclusivity, and network decentralization.

active_posts.title: Reiterating centralized coinjoin (Wasabi & Samourai) deanonymization attacks
active_posts.summary:
- Vulnerabilities in Wasabi & GingerWallet and CoinJoin protocols pose deanonymization risks.
- Technical flaws allow malicious coordinators to deanonymize transactions in both Whirlpool and WabiSabi protocols.
- Despite attempts at solutions, underlying issues in verification and control mechanisms remain unaddressed, threatening user privacy and security.

active_posts.title: Great Consensus Cleanup Revival
active_posts.summary:
- The analysis highlights Bitcoin's vulnerabilities and proposes improvements for network security and performance.
- Key issues include the timewarp exploit and the proposal of adjusting retarget periods and transaction constraints.
- The proposal encourages community input and debates changes, especially regarding block size and technical standards.

active_posts.title: PPLNS with job declaration
active_posts.summary:
- Development is underway on an SV2 extension to enhance transparency and fairness in mining payouts.
- The extension enables miners to choose transactions, offering control over mining job fee structures.
- The project seeks reviews and contributions to refine the system, still in the developmental phase.

active_posts.title: Ecash TIDES using Cashu and Stratum v2
active_posts.summary:
- Integrating BDHKE into Stratum v2 enhances privacy and auditability of mining rewards.
- The process involves blinded messages and signatures, ensuring transaction integrity.
- Proposal emphasizes on privacy, flexibility, and includes further resources for in-depth understanding.

today_in_history_posts.title: Bitcoin Core 0.12.0 release candidate 1 available
today_in_history_posts.summary:
- Bitcoin Core version 0.12.0rc1 binaries are now available on the official website.
- It introduces new features, bug fixes, and improvements, including enhanced transaction speed.
- Users are encouraged to report bugs using Github's issue tracker.

today_in_history_posts.title: Protocol for multiple in-flight updates.
today_in_history_posts.summary:
- Rusty inquiries about Joseph and ml's HTLC negotiation protocol for adaptation.
- He details c-lightning's protocol steps and mentions revocation hash's role in commitments.
- Proposes variants to improve process by allowing multiple changes before commitment.

today_in_history_posts.title: Thoughts on scaling and consensus changes (2023)
today_in_history_posts.summary:
- Bitcoin scaling involves creating 50,000 off-chain "bitcoin banks" for user transactions.
- Innovative solutions like Coinpools and sidechains aim to balance security with lower costs.
- Infrastructure builders should focus on tools for regulatory compliance and efficient Layer 1 exits.
